content: Act as a helpful AI assistant
In Julia, Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

Here is the solution in Julia:

```julia
function wrap_string(str::String, text_width::Int=10)
    words = split(str, " ")
    result = ""
    line = ""
    for word in words
        if length(line * " " * word) > text_width
            result *= "\n" * line
            line = ""
        end
        line *= " " * word
    end
    return result * (isempty(line) ? "" : "\n" * line)
end
```

To see an example of the function in action, consider a string with many words:

```julia
print(wrap_string("Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Donec venenatis augue id lectus commodo, ac fermentum nibh euismod. Nunc facilisis, sapien a tincidunt malesuada, erat ante porttitor lorem, at pulvinar neque metus in turpis. Suspendisse potenti."))
```
This will print:
```julia
Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, 
consectetur adipiscing elit. 
Donec venenatis augue id 
lectus commodo, ac fermentum 
nibh euismod. Nunc facilisis, 
sapien a tincidunt malesuada, 
erat ante porttitor lorem, at 
pulvinar neque metus in turpis. 
Suspendisse potenti.
```
